meanings.definition: The quality of being resolutely or dutifully firm and unwavering.
meanings.sent1: Her steadfastnesses in completing the project on time impressed everyone.
meanings.sent2: His steadfastnesses to his beliefs never wavered, no matter the challenges.
meanings.sent3: The cat showed its steadfastnesses in waiting for the mouse, not moving an inch.
meanings.sent4: The mountain stood with the steadfastnesses of a guardian, protecting the valley below.
meanings.sent5: The oak tree's steadfastnesses in weathering storms inspired admiration.

meanings.definition: The state of being loyal and committed.
meanings.sent1: Their steadfastnesses to their friendship lasted through thick and thin.
meanings.sent2: The soldier's steadfastnesses to their country were unwavering.
meanings.sent3: The dog's steadfastnesses to its owner were evident in its wagging tail.
meanings.sent4: The old watch showed the steadfastnesses of time, ticking away faithfully.
meanings.sent5: The sunflower's steadfastnesses in following the sun symbolized loyalty.

meanings.definition: The act of being steadfast or unwavering in purpose or loyalty.
meanings.sent1: His steadfastnesses in keeping his promises earned him respect.
meanings.sent2: The team showed their steadfastnesses by never giving up, even when behind.
meanings.sent3: The clown's steadfastnesses in juggling bananas brought laughter to the audience.
meanings.sent4: The river flowed with the steadfastnesses of time, carving its path through the land.
meanings.sent5: The student's steadfastnesses in studying paid off with top grades.
